summary: To safeguard federal funds, it's critical to reduce fraud and improper payments—payments that should not have been made or were made in an incorrect amount. We estimated that the federal government could lose between $233 billion and $521 billion annually to fraud alone. We testified that agencies have made progress in implementing our recommendations to address fraud and improper payments but need to do more...
title: Payment Integrity: Significant Improvements Are Needed to Address Improper Payments and Fraud
